grid_functions module

grid_functions.get_empty_stategrid(x_nodes, y_nodes)

Returns state grid according to parameters

Parameters

  • x_nodes¶ (int) – number of nodes on the x-axis

  • y_nodes¶ (int) – number of nodes on the y-axis

Returns

StateGrid of shape (x_nodes, y_nodes) pointing to 0.

grid_functions.change_grid_states(state_grid, node_states)

Modify grid states according to items in node_states.

Parameters

  • node_states¶ (list [Node]) – List containing Nodes

  • state_grid¶ (StateGrid) – See (StateGrid)

Returns

Modified state grid.

grid_functions.get_rendering_grid(x_nodes, y_nodes, x_start=50, y_start=100, z_start=150, node_dist=105)

Create a grid that contains 2D-coordinates for each position.

Parameters

  • x_nodes¶ (int) – number of nodes on the x-axis

  • y_nodes¶ (int) – number of nodes on the y-axis

  • x_start¶ (float) – x coordinate value that signifies position of the first node on the x axis

  • y_start¶ (float) – y coordinate value that signifies position of the first node on the y axis

  • z_start¶ (float) – z coordinate value of spacing of nodes to the x-y-plane

  • node_dist¶ (float) – distance between each node on the x-y-plane

Returns

numpy.ndarray and MountingWallData

grid_functions.set_transition_points(state_grid, transition_points_set)

Sets transition points in the state grid.
